intro: Cullumia setosa var. setosa, commonly known as the slender cullumia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the plant family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and smartweeds. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, slender stems, and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert environments.
